ngiemboon: Mǒonsê pâ melÿò pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ la tsẅii mbwó láʼ ngie: Pi tÿɔ́gɔ kwò na membʉ̌ ntsèm mie n nǎ né pi lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.
en: Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people, “Keep every command I am giving you today.

ngiemboon: Alyɛ̌ʼ gie pi ge túm ntse Juundʉŋ tà kúu na yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a é Ssé gi, náa né pi, pi pʉʼʉ memǎa metóon ńtÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g, ńdɔgɔ fɔ́gɔ mbwǒon, ńzɔ́ʼ.
en: When you cross the Jordan into the land the Lord your God is giving you, set up large stones and cover them with plaster.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge láʼ gʉa tà túmo Juundʉŋ, é leen gwaa gɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé pamángʉanjʉʼ pí náa ne pi páʼ à la kaʼa mbwó pi, é ŋweʼe mɔɔn membʉ̌ mie n náa né pi lɔɔn, á na memǎa metóon ŋwɛ́ mie pi pʉʼʉ́ ńtÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g. É ngwòŋ gẅie tsetsáʼ áa wó, ḿboŋo mmó tɛʼ, mélɛ̂g pɔ́ melwòŋwáʼ gwɔ́ wó tɛʼ.
en: Write all the words of this law on the stones after you cross to enter the land the Lord your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey,   as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, has promised you.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gwɔ́ tà túm ntse Juundʉŋ, é kwɔ́ʼɔ ndùm lekwɛ́ Embaa, é pʉʼʉ mɔɔn metǒon mie n tsẅǐi nò yɛ̌ né pi lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn lɔɔn, é tÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g, é piŋ lɔgɔ fɔ́gɔ mbwǒon, é zɔ́ʼ.
en: When you have crossed the Jordan, you are to set up these stones on Mount Ebal, as I am commanding you today, and you are to cover them with plaster.

ngiemboon: Pi ge kúu jʉʼó, é pwóon jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi. Pi ge pwóon lé metǒon mie mé kaa lɔgɔ tsɔ́ mmó tʉ̌ ḿbag wɔ́;
en: Build an altar of stones there to the Lord your God #— #do not use any iron tool on them.

ngiemboon: pi ge lɔg pɔ́ ndàʼ metǒon mie mé kaa pag mbyě mǒ wɔ́, é pwóon jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi. À gwɔ́ jʉʼ gie pi ge néŋe é nuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, ńná né Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, á wó;
en: Use uncut stones to build the altar of the Lord your God and offer burnt offerings to the Lord your God on it.

ngiemboon: á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ jʉʼ gie pi ge néŋe é nuŋe pwɔʼ mbʉ́lè wó; pi piŋ ńtyé pɔ́ jʉʼó, á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a é Ssé gi, ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, ḿbiŋ ńkág.
en: There you are to sacrifice fellowship offerings, eat, and rejoice in the presence of the Lord your God.

ngiemboon: Pi ge cʉ́ʼʉ léŋweʼe mɔɔn membʉ̌, á na metǒon mɔɔn, é ŋweʼe tà e kẅɛ kwàʼ mboŋó.
en: Write clearly all the words of this law on the plastered stones.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê pâ pʉ̀a Lěvî pie ée panuŋepwɔʼ, é gɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm ngie: Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, pi láŋte ńjúʼ, pi ée lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn mbà pi cʉ̌ʼ pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi.
en: Moses and the Levitical priests spoke to all Israel, “Be silent, Israel, and listen! This day you have become the people of the Lord your God.

ngiemboon: Pi gẅiin léjúʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ḿbiŋ ńgiŋ páʼ membʉ̌ mé, lâ mentÿɔgɔ́ mé mie mèŋ náa né pi lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, é ne ńzɛ́te.
en: Obey the Lord your God and follow his commands and statutes I am giving you today.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lyɛʼó, Mǒonsê gíŋe ńtsẅii mbwó láʼ ngie:
en: On that day Moses commanded the people,

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńdáʼ ńgwɔ́ tà ńtúm ntse Juundʉŋ, epʉ̀a Simeyoŋ, lâ pʉ̀a Lěvî, lâ pʉ̀a Yúndà, lâ pʉ̀a Esakaa, lâ pʉ̀a Yesyɛ̂b, ńgÿo pʉ̀a Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ, e pú ńtyé ndùm lekwɛ́ Ngalizîm, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè na láʼ.
en: “When you have crossed the Jordan, these tribes will stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge gÿo gwaa ne néŋe mbʉ́lè, epʉ̀a Lẅímbèŋ, lâ pʉ̀a Ngâd, lâ pʉ̀a Ashÿɛ̂ɛ, lâ pʉ̀a Zambuloŋ, lâ pʉ̀a Ndaŋ tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Nɛbtali, e tyé yɔ́b ndùm lekwɛ́ Embaa, lénéŋ ndòon.
en: And these tribes will stand on Mount Ebal to deliver the curse: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Lěvî ge láʼ tyé mvfò pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, é lɔg ngyè tetʉ̂, é gɔɔn ngie:
en: The Levites will proclaim in a loud voice to every Israelite:

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à kwǒon tútú kà ńdɔ́ɔn pɔ́ tʉ̌ ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛte tsɔ́ messé ndyɛ̀ʼɛ wɔ́ɔ; ńgee éshúu ńtÿɔ́gɔ jʉʼ, ńguʼte. Sɛ̌ ntí shúm sie ngàŋlevfò lɔgɔ mbwó ńnyɛte, ée mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgwɔ́ ntʉ̀ nò tepòŋ. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The person who makes a carved idol or cast image, which is detestable to the Lord, the work of a craftsman, and sets it up in secret is cursed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à gwága tá we pɔ́ má we. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The one who dishonors his father or mother is cursed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à tsɔ́ʼɔ lepàa nkáʼ fɛ̌ we, ésẅɛʼte. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The one who moves his neighbor’s boundary marker is cursed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo afʉ̀menÿɔ́g, á fʉa mánzsè. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The one who leads a blind person astray on the road is cursed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à sẅɛ́ɛ kÿoláʼ, kà méntsě wɔ́ɔ, kà mpfɔ̌g manzwě wɔ́ɔ, á na ntsaŋ. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The one who denies justice to a resident alien, a fatherless child, or a widow is cursed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à nuŋé nzwě tá we, ńtí nue à lɔgɔ púʼu, ńgyá jʉʼʉ shʉ́ tá we. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The one who sleeps with his father’s wife is cursed, for he has violated his father’s marriage bed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à zɔ́ʼɔ nɔ̀ɔn, à kwoŋ, é gwɔ́ yɛ̌ ntí nɔ̀ɔn wɔ́ɔ. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The one who has sexual intercourse with any animal is cursed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à nuŋe fɛ̌ we wemanzwě, zyé tá kà zyé má wɔ́ɔ. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The one who sleeps with his sister, whether his father’s daughter or his mother’s daughter is cursed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à nuŋe ngěm we. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The one who sleeps with his mother-in-law is cursed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à shúu ńzẅé fɛ̌ we. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The one who secretly kills his neighbor is cursed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie mé júu yé, á cúɔ tefʉ̀a, ńzẅé. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘The one who accepts a bribe to kill an innocent person is cursed.’

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à te tÿɔ́gɔ kwò, á na mɔɔn membʉ̌, ńgiŋ páʼ é ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́. Aláʼa ntsèm leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!
en: ‘Anyone who does not put the words of this law into practice is cursed.’
